item.title: Display name on top of screen help
item.dc:creator: @o.O_O.o o.O O.o
item.description:
@o.O_O.o wrote:

I had the same problem. It’s the closeListener deal. I never fixed it.

Since your timer is in milliseconds, apply algebra.

public int secondsLeft = resetTimer/1000; public int minutesLeft = secondsLeft/60;

sendQuest(minutesLeft+":"+secondsLeft, int);

Read full topic

item.title: Display name on top of screen help
item.dc:creator: @o.O_O.o o.O O.o
item.description:
@o.O_O.o wrote:

I bet you did something wrong :s
I gotta go though. Keep trying, as I am not wrong.

  1. Just add it like under public class client extends Player implements runnable { or whatever. Right under the {

  2. Right under the { in public boolean process() { is where you copy and paste that.

  3. In the public void writePlayers() {, which is in your originial post, just add what I gave you under the Players On line.

  4. Under the } in the thing you added into boolean process(), add writePlayers();

Trust me, you’ll get it Make sure everything you add is within the { and } of the methods.

Read full topic

item.title: Display name on top of screen help
item.dc:creator: @o.O_O.o o.O O.o
item.description:
@o.O_O.o wrote:

Anywhere outside of a method yet inside client.java, add:

public int countdown = (time in seconds multiplied by 2);

In public void process(), add:

if(countdown > 0) { countdown--; }

Then in public void writePlayers(), add:

sendFrame126("@red@Seconds left = @blu@"+countdown, 6574);

In process(), also add:

writePlayers();

Sorry, can’t explain it any better. Do it step by step; I use spacing for a reason.

Read full topic

item.title: Display name on top of screen help
item.dc:creator: @o.O_O.o o.O O.o
item.description:
@o.O_O.o wrote:

Anywhere, add:

public int countdown = (time in seconds multiplied by 2);

In process(), add:

if(countdown > 0) { countdown--; }

Then in writePlayers(), add:

sendFrame126("@red@Seconds left = @blu@"+countdown, 6574);

In process(), also add:

writePlayers();

That should work.
